definition: variant of 貪得無厭|贪得无厌[tan1 de2 wu2 yan4]
to live off the fat of the land (idiom)/to have a luxurious lifestyle

sentences.english: He has never rested on his laurels.
sentences.chinese: 他從不饜足今朝的成績。

sentences.english: Can these glut the greedy palate of Death?
sentences.chinese: 能不能餵飽無饜的死亡？

sentences.english: Nice to see you when more.
sentences.chinese: 真自高饜足再次見到你。

sentences.english: The construction material answers our purpose satisfactorily.
sentences.chinese: 這種修建築材料料能饜足咱們的需要。

sentences.english: That leaves a heart high-sorrowful and cloyed.
sentences.chinese: 它不會使心靈饜足和悲傷。

sentences.english: Domplacency is the enemy of study.
sentences.chinese: 學習的仇敵是本身的饜足。

sentences.english: When Jesus saw the Temple being desecrated by unbridled greed.
sentences.chinese: 當耶穌看到聖殿被一些無饜的貪婪所玷污的時候。

sentences.english: We make foreign workers to meet the needs of our economic development.
sentences.chinese: 我們引進外勞，是爲了饜足經濟生長的必要。

sentences.english: These will be able to satisfy the peoples'demands to the handset's games.
sentences.chinese: 這些都將能大好的饜足未來人們對德律風遊戲的需求。

definition: to slander/to defame/to speak ill of
operculum (Latin: little lid)/a covering flap (in various branches of anatomy)
